titleStmt.title: Azro Dyer to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG2148

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
Evansville, Indiana,
July 11th 1865
To his Excellency Gov Bramlette,
Frankfort Kentucky,
Dear Sir,
At the suggestion of several members of the Bar in this city. I apply to you for an appointment as Commissioner of Deeds for the State of Kentucky.
I formerly practiced law in McLean County Kentucky and held a commission from you as Notary Public February 9th 1864.
I have some acquaintance with Mr. Harlan of your towrn, Mr Page also, and refer you to any member of the legislature from the 2nd Congressional district.

Comr Deeds
Indiana
Azro Dyer
Comd
12 July 1865
